answers.answer: Hi.Other explanations would include some form of nerve compression, which can be from structures around the joint (ligaments, tendons, bones) or from the origins of the nerve from the spine.  The diabetes also adds to this problem in the sense that high blood sugar can make the nerves more vulnerable to injuries.  It is best that your sugar is checked and controlled, and be evaluated with the possibility of nerve compression in mind (possible through MRI's of the spine).  Regards.
